# SWALLOW-CLASS RACING SHUTTLE
[color=#a4885c]Ship Size:[/color] Small (Micro)
[color=#a4885c]Recommended Crew:[/color] 1-2
[color=#a4885c]Power Gen Type:[/color] Plasma
[color=#a4885c]Expeditions:[/color] None
[color=#a4885c]IFF Console:[/color] None
"A micro shuttle for those who care about only one thing: getting somewhere as fast as they possibly can."
# PREFLIGHT CHECKLIST
## 1. Power supply
## 1.1. Battery units
- Check that the substation unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the APC unit's Main Breaker is toggled on. - Check the APC unit's current Load (W).
## 1.2. P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit
- Check that the P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit has fuel. For extended flights make sure that you have enough fuel stockpiled to sustain prolonged power generation during flight. - Check that the P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit is set to HV output. - Set Target Power to 9-10 [bold]kW[/bold]. - Start the P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit.
## 2. Other checks
- Check that the gyroscope is anchored, powered, and enabled. - Check that the mini gravity generator is anchored, powered, and enabled.
## Sidenotes
- The Gyroscope and Gravity generators for this shuttle are situated outside the shuttle proper, but don't worry, they're protected by railings. - Wyvern Shipyards is not liable for any injuries sustained while running maintenance on the Swallow.
